intro: Gagea vanensis, commonly known as the Van mountain scilla, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its bulbs are adapted for survival in harsh, alpine conditions, storing nutrients and water to endure cold winters and dry summers. Gagea vanensis is often found in open woodlands and meadows, where it contributes to the floral diversity of its habitat.
